Reviews.Title: “Cielo Mar”
Reviews.Author: FilRicanChic
Reviews.Content: We spent our last days at this hotel and the only good thing about the property is the location with its spectacular view, everything else is downhill. The hotel is very dated and renovation is greatly needed.

Reviews.Title: “A good memory for the family”
Reviews.Author: GabrielSan
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days and can't complain. The place has a nice restaurant with an astonishing view. The prices are more than reasonable. The room was alright, I just wish I could have reserved an upper level room; the first level view near the pool gets blocked by a garden and palm trees. The staff was courteous and helpful at all times. The pool is not too deep but most kids will love it, mine did. It has a lot of shopping malls near and places to visit. The nearest beach is beautiful and like 5 minutes away. I would stay again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the complaining?!”
Reviews.Author: HollyStarSan
Reviews.Content: We slept four people in a room at $85/night... at that price, it was EXACTLY what I'd expect. And after reading the reviews here, I would have expected FAR worse. The rooms, a little out of date. The bathroom, not modern. The hotel, kind of quiet (we were the loud ones, I'm guessing). The bar, closed at 9 pm (with little to do near-by). Cleanliness, GREAT! View (ocean side), GREAT! Staff's service, GREAT! Food, GREAT! Food service, AWESOME! Pool, FUN! Linens were clean. Television, WHO CARES ABOUT A TELEVISION WHEN THEY"RE ON VACATION?! ...no free breakfast :( ...but the one I paid for was AWESOME :) If you want the Hilton experience of modern, fancy, expensive decor, and a flat screen tv, pay the higher price and go there. If you don't compare this hotel with something like that, you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Hermoso Atardecer / Beautiful Sunset”
Reviews.Author: kma29
Reviews.Content: Mi experiencia fue EXCELENTE!! PasÃ© mi luna de miel en este hotel y jamÃ¡s me arrepentirÃ­a. El servicio, la comida y el precio fuÃ© uno excelente. Fui en temporada baja y hasta de regalaron una noche. La vista es hermosa y pasar el atardecer en la terraza disfrutando de buena comida No tiene precio. ALTAMENTE RECOMENDADO!!! ENGLISH -------- My experience was GREAT! I spent my honeymoon at this hotel and I never regret. The service, food and the price was an excellent one. I went in low season and they gave us an one night extra. The view is beautiful and spend the evening on the terrace enjoying of good food Priceless. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service!”
Reviews.Author: francistorres
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!!!! This place need to close ASAP the service is bad the food is bad the parking is bad and the price is bad

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience...do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Ejruiz
Reviews.Content: Accomodations: Dirty, no hot water, poor tv and cable, insecure door locks, no pests control, worn out towels and bedding; outdated, all rooms and structures need to be renovated. Service: staff is friendly but lacks a service culture. I am a PR resident. Tourists: their are plenty other hotels that represent us better, stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “it was waaay better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Enid M
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that I was pretty scared by all the negative reviews I read here. Especially, because I read them AFTER I booked in CieloMar. So I was not looking forward going there, but had no choice; so of course I went. Ok, so we got there like at 2pm and the check in was not until 3pm, so they let us sign but they could give us the keys after 3. So we had a chance to walk around a little while they were cleaning the rooms. We took a peak of some of them and were allowed to see some of the new rooms. They were super clean neat and smelled really good, and were very cool, considering the heat out there was 100F. We tried to change rooms to the new ones, but they were already reserved, so we went to see our room (i thought they were bad, without seeing them-because of the reviews i read). The room looked OK so we stayed. Our room was interior, 1 bed and no balcony. I really have to say that the foor tiles were nice, the decoration was pretty up-to-date (it was not old looking at all!!). The towels in the room smelled clean, the bed was pretty neat and clean. Although it was a hard mattress, and the bedcover was a little old looking, I slept well and for the price we payed ($74 the night), you can't expect them to be from a ritz-carlton. The sheets don't work very good against the cold room, but you can always control the temperature of the air conditioner. Talking about the air conditioner, we had to ask maintenance to help us with it because we tried to put it a little cooler and don't know what we did that it turned to "fan". So the maintenance guy came and helped us with it. He was really friendly and cordial, too. The bathroom in our room had no ceiling, so if it was at night and you had to pee, the bathroom light could light all the room. And the TV was an old-school one, but it worked and it was no problem for me. The pool.... the pool was clean and I didn't see animals floating anywhere in the pool. Of course, you can't control nature anyways. The bar & restaurant area has a great, beautiful view !! The waiters were extra nice and friendly. I did not had anything to eat, but we did had the drink of the house and it was good. So overall, we paid very low for our stay, and I cannot complain. For me being a person used to staying in luxury hotels and great commodities, it was way better than expected. The service, cleanliness, the rooms, everything. Oh, and free parking with security!! You don't get that anywhere !! You are not paying for a 4 star hotel, but I really recommend this place. It was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Katjoel09
Reviews.Content: Well at first after reading the review I said this people are crazy the place was so good and for the price was excellent. The first day we decided to get it in the pool,which it didn't even smell like bleach the walls were green and nasty, at the eating salon is spider web everywhere,thought the food was good until we ask for some fried chicken and it was blood on the plate, then we had sone chicken soup in this little bowl it was litterely more chicken than anything forvtwo orders and piÃ±a colada 33.00$. Then we went to get lunch at 1pm and the kitchen was closed until 4pm,the bed was suppost to ce queen ,not full,overall I won't do it again...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: mayin
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, cocroaches, and other insects in rooms, noisy guests, rude staff. Don, go there

Reviews.Title: “I'M SAD TO SAY "PUERTO RICO LO HACE MEJOR"”
Reviews.Author: denise1020017
Reviews.Content: Its sad that you have to really say its better to leave prto get better services and hotel facilities. i want to be a puertorican that does internal tourism, but really pr doesnt deserve it. It was my first time staying here, its average, it could be better, the pool is great, but the drinks super expensive for a pina colada and a drink i paid $17.00 plus the tip. i had a package with meals and still you have to pay a difference IN STO DGO is not like that, the bed was horrible, i came back with severe back pain and a stiff neck, I got massaged by the matress springs, they need to season more the fish and meat, more garlic and salt will do the trick. The facilities is small, no where to walk around or at least sit down by the restaurant where the view to the ocean is, put some chairs or benches. be more consciuos of the mosquito invasion by the bar, at least spray arount or use citronella candles. i had to buy an off to spray myself down before eating. when they rent the facility for school activities or something else, it looses the magic of why we go there, to be in peace and quiet, th pool is invaded by a buch of teenagers fuzzing around, staff be more friendly. no game room,, at least have a billiard table. i love aguadilla and stayed in other inns there and i have left from those places much more satisfied for what i paid. i wont be back, unless its improved, otherwise i will say "puerto rico lo hace peor"!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Serious maintenance needed”
Reviews.Author: Eleduard
Reviews.Content: The rooms need an update as very old and poor mainteined furnitures,beeding and doors is what you get. The AC was broken and it make a pool inside the room(needed in order to move us to another room at last). Needed to cancel the weekend reservation the same night to find a better place. They doesn't even honored a breakfast with stay. The pool and the ocean view are nice.

Reviews.Title: “for that price ... it's daylight robbery”
Reviews.Author: Gwadinina
Reviews.Content: well ... where to start? all the bad reviews are true! On the positive side, most of the staff is friendly and will go the extra mile but two of the receptionists could do with more training on how to greet/deal with customers and the waiter who served us the first (and only) time we ate at the restaurant could gain on honesty. In term of location, I understand it is a great place for surfers as it is close to many spots but that's it. Although many other interresting places (suggested in their handbook) are from reachable distance if you have your own transportation and are planning to do some sightseeing. On the other side, as we tour the hotel on our first day there, we realised (from the view from the restaurant) that it appeared to be still in construction ... however other bits tended to prove that it was either old or badly maintained. A case in point is "the whale" a small slide for kids in the pool area. The paint on it is totally faded and in some area the steel even shows. Another review mentionned the plumbing system, and I thought come on, that was until I realised I could hear my neighboor shower, flush their loo ... and that the pressure of the water in the shower also changed if my neighbour was having a shower at the same time. The fact that I could hear all this was a good indication of the soundproofing as well ... paper thin walls and doors and noisy a/c made my nights there virtually sleepless. Oh nearly forgot ... what they say about the critters in and outside the pool is true too ... in the shower next to the pool we were greeted by a cosy spider (in full swing in its wide web) and a dead cocroach and inside the pool ... an unidentified amphibian. I stayed in Puerto Rico for 10 days and I went to three different hotels, this one was the worst ... and for that price, I will not recommend it to any one I know!!!

Reviews.Title: “This old reviews do no justice to the real thing”
Reviews.Author: ezdef
Reviews.Content: Ok first ill start saying that all this ols reviews dont do the actual place any justice. I just left the hotel today and had to come in and writte a real up to date review, I dont know if they had all this problems in the past but all i saw was the opposite. Like most of you that read all this old reviews I got worried before arriving, I called in advance to voice my concern about all I read, they addresed my conserns and assured me me and my FAM would have a great time. They did have some bugs on the pool because of the location of the hotel, you cant control mother nature... an employee took care of them with quickness. The food might be a bit pricy but the Churrasco Steak was unbelievable. 1. SERVICE- The service provided was great, the front desk was very cortious, friendly and above all very profetional. The BAR/REST employees where just as friendly. 2.CLEANLINESS- The room was clean, ROOM SERVICE came by every single day and in cases we where not ready for them they would return, none of our personal stuff was messed with. The bathrooms where clean and attended to every single day. The common areas where very clean considering they are in wide open spaces in front of the beach. 3.LOCATION- You all have read it over and over again the view is expectacular, and close to everithing. 4.VALUE- You pay for what you get, good bang for your buck. 5.ROOMS- They have brand new furniture in the rooms, the A/C is realllllllllly cold. SHORT COMINGS..... 1. The TV really need an update... or at least a bit bigger, and maybe a DVD , but they did have cable. 2. The game room needs a serious update... 3. Food might be a bit pricey but the hotel is close to all kinda eating places from MC Donalds, Burger King, Wendys, Churches chicken, KFC,Pizza Hut, Dominoes Pizza, a few chinese food places, Subways, Baskin Robbins, Food Court in the mall and all kinda local rest. and local cafes. SO THIS IS A GREAT PLACE PEOPLE....TRUST ME

Reviews.Title: “Horrible STAY.....STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: janiraaquino
Reviews.Content: The blankets were stained with blood droppings and beds were never made until asked to. They asked us to keep quiet and that they would take care of the problem internally. The employees were covering for each other. The mattress were a disaster and we were unable to sleep in them. My child slept on bug infested sheets

Reviews.Title: “Small room, cheap, pool not maintained”
Reviews.Author: ynievs
Reviews.Content: I stayed during the 4th of July holiday. The pool was packed, they let walk-ins to pay only for the pool use so you will have A LOT of people in the pool. The pool was nice and clean on Saturday but on Sunday it was full of dirt and insects, they don't clean it as often. My overall pool experience was very good. They have two pools 4'-5' and two pools for infants-toddlers. Since I travel with my 9 month baby the close time at 7pm didnt affect me much as I was exausted. The room I chose (1 king bed) was VERY small, you can barely walk in it. It was difficult for my to open my baby's playard. If you choose the rooms with two beds, their bathrooms have no ceilings and everybody in the room can smell your business. The hall of those rooms also stinks. There are many good restaurants in the area, just ask locals. Some of them are Nomadas, 110 Thai, Luna Marina, for desserts go to Creaciones La Cuesta (Next to Quiznos) The internet is only available next to the front desk. They give you the TV remote at check-in so make sure to bring it when checking-out or you'll need to go back to the room for it. i think they are made from gold and they want to keep them at the front desk all the time. haha. The hotel was ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Please Read reviews before considering this place”
Reviews.Author: odemarisk
Reviews.Content: I went to my high school class reunion (30 Anniversary). From the very beginning it was a mess. Front desk very disorganized. I finally got the key to the room and the room was very small the bathroom was filthy and stunk like old urine. I took a shower the whole time with flip flops. The service was awful. There were no shampoo or conditioner, no blow dryer and only 3 towels (1for the floor) . I ordered conditioner and they brought me shampoo I ordered clean towels and they never brought them in the room...my husband offered to pick them up and they said he couldn't pick them up that I had to wait... well I waited and waited until I got dry with the air conditioner (towels never arrived..until next morning). The rooms have an iron board but no iron. I had a small balcony that was very nice it had a little table and 2 chairs to seat. I also had a pool and ocean view so that wasn't so bad. This was the place that I stayed most of the time.The pictures online are very deceiving. The pool is not as big or clean as it looks. The service was really bad. Other rooms (my friends) had air conditioner broken, leaking, not going on, dirty bathrooms. The only thing that made the stay nice was the reunion (30 Anniversary High School Reunion) besides that.... forget it. This was the first and the last time I will ever stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: marquesa296
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night before leaving Puerto Rico. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The view of the ocean was beautiful. The pools were clean and fun! The shuttle to the airport was on time. The only negative comment would be that I think they were doing some renovations to the kitchen so the food service was a little slow. But the waiter was extremely gracious. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible, even for puerto ricans!!!”
Reviews.Author: crimsonchik_apo
Reviews.Content: we were researching this place to possibly host our wedding and reception. they were rude and unfriendly, even to my fiance who is a local! (i thought maybe the reviews for the emplyees' manners was because of typical american attitudes). nothing about their establishment makes up for the treatment they give.

Reviews.Title: “Please read negative reviews before booking”
Reviews.Author: YancieDale
Reviews.Content: Ugh.. Everything said in other TA reviews is dead-on. The entrance grounds are nice, so we were hopeful as we drove in. My husband booked this night stay before I had a chance to read the reviews or we would not have stayed here. The photos on their web-site are obviously photo-shopped. For example, the â€œwhale slideâ€� has peeling paint and is very faded, despite looking brand-new in the picture. The balconies are rusting and have rebar sticking out of the sides. The room was tiny, musty and dirty. We got 2 small towels, no hand-towels or washcloths. The shower had mold growing in it. I spent the entire time at this hotel in my flip flops. The view was OK, but nothing spectacular. The entire island is gorgeous, so its hard to get a bad view unless you are looking at another building. This hotel is very sub-standard to most US motel standards. Think no-name roadside motel in a small town, then make it dirtier. For the price (90 US/night), this was a huge mistake. However, there are no good options in Aquadilla, in our opinion. We drove around to see if there was something better, figuring we would scrap the $90 and try someplace that was clean, but this town is not the best place on the island to stay. After visiting crash boat beach, the area seems to cater to younger, low budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful vista not enough to make up for lousy rooms and food.”
Reviews.Author: marcitos812
Reviews.Content: The view is great, no question there. The food is not so good and the service is awful. Their is no communication among the staff. Our hot water handle came off (luckily after we turned the water off) and they did not fix it. We left the room open for them all day and when we asked them about it when we got back to the hotel they didn't even remember that there had been a problem and all their 'maintenance' staff had gone home. Then we asked to be moved rooms only to be put in the room next door with the ceiling in the bathroom molding and the water pressure almost non existent. Also, we ended up at the Aguadilla Good Samaritan Hospital for ear infections and saw at least 10 people with moderate to severe jellyfish stings. So be careful in the water. There is only wifi in the main lobby despite in room cards saying otherwise. If you want internet bring a cable, but no garuntees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Afterall!”
Reviews.Author: RealisticNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Originally I was disappointed with the appearance of the room that was given to me. I would rate it a 1. The so called queen size bed is a full size here in the States. The bathroom was tiny, just a shower, toilet ran all night and the sink was clogged (room 407). I've posted pics of the first room. The television needed an upgrade, the refrigerator was in front of the closet which made it difficult to open. I requested a room change (416) to a room with double full size beds and plenty of room to move around in, the bathroom was more than double the size of my first room and they did not charge me any additional monies. I rate a 2 and 1/2. I wish I had pics to post on this room but take my word for it, this room was much better with a better looking television and a desk with a chair and a table with two chairs. The food was good but a little pricey if you eat locally the prices are much better. Anyway despite the disappointment at first, it turned out to be a really nice vacation spot. Don't expect luxury as hotels in Puerto Rico are really expensive and for approximately $100 a night what more can you ask for? The staff were extremely nice except for 1 person, a waitress working early shift, never smiled, obviously there to do her job and that was it. By the end of my stay I manage to get a smile out of her but she could have been a little more pleasant. The hotel is close to the main roads and close to crash boat beach, the Marriot Casino, and to Jobos, where you can experience the most beautiful horse rides on the beach and inexpensive ($45 for two hours), and about a hour away from the Camuy Caves (third largest in the world). There is a gorgeous view from the dining area, a must see view. You do not need a room with a view to engage and enjoy in the spectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “the website is not what you get”
Reviews.Author: nevels
Reviews.Content: first i did not have wifi in my room or in the lobby, the rest. is expensive breakefast and diner was about $100 for too. the a/c had a leek and cable tv was about 15 cannels. its not a hotel its a motel

Reviews.Title: “Warning: hotel website is decietful!!!”
Reviews.Author: petehz
Reviews.Content: The hotels website does not reflect the real condition of this rundown facility whatsoever. They claimed to have great "Romantic Packages" which was far from the truth. When we arrived, they did not have the ocean view room we requested and we were put in a temporary room in the meantime which was a rundown room with a broken shower head and no hot water. We then woke up to the sounds of jackhammers blasting away at 6:30 in the morning - apparently they were in the process of renovating the swimming pool which were not made aware of, so in essence, the pool was out of service. The restaurant which was part of the package was only open in the afternoon and early evening, which meant the free breakfast they said was part of the package was non existant. On the third day we finally moved into our correct room and by the end of the day the A/C went out! We then had to move to ANOTHER room which was maginally OK except no ocean view again. The staff made my stay equally as uncomfortable showing nothing but rudeness and indifference concerning our situation. We finally had enough and moved to another hotel down the road called "EL Pedregal" which was much nicer and has Jacuzzi tubs included! We wasted 3 days of our honeyroom being needlessly aggravated by the Cielo Mar hotel and its staff. This place should definitely be put out of its misery. I highly suggest you avoid this hotel like the PLAGUE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Karishna
Reviews.Content: The view is without a doubt breathtaking. And that's also without a doubt the only good thing about this place. From the disappointing and unwelcoming staff, the lack of maintenance, smelly rooms (and not good flowery smell), torn fridge in the room to the vase of old dirty water and dead flowers at the Front Desk this whole experience was simply HORRIBLE. The "tongue" of the whale at the pool is literally black, the stairs leading to the pool are covered with a green moss like crap (slippery) and the pool itself is dirty and full of leaves. The lobby area is very dirty, the floors very dusty. No elevators, and the stairs handrails very rusty and sticky. None of the staff has a uniform, their wear anything they want, any color, any style, and the housekeepers are wearing nurse uniforms. Very unprofessional. And in fact the musty stench in the rooms was so horrible that we could not stay at all. We ended up having to move to another hotel. So please do not waste your time and money. Do not even consider this place. It looks NOTHING like the internet page!!!

Reviews.Title: “the best on the west coast for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jacapaca
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business trips to the west area of PR I use this hotel. Staff is always friendly and as helpfull as their limitatios can give. The restaurant is not luxury but very good local food, price and staff. Rooms are good but very poor ilumination, no radio and no good tv signal. Besides for the price is a great deal specially if you get that grrrrrreeeaaattttt sunset view!!!!!! Belive me, I go to Aguadilla every two month for the last seven years and this is by far the best option.

Reviews.Title: “As my fellow traveler said, 'Craptastic!'”
Reviews.Author: Doug H
Reviews.Content: I rarely write one-star reviews. As a younger traveler, my standards are not as refined, I suppose. Given that, I would never stay at Cielo Mar again. Granted, this was a last minute business trip to Aguadilla, and there are no 'American' hotels in the area. That said, this one is miserable. First off, you plug in its address to any GPS device, and it directs you to the middle of a residential area not near the hotel. After searching 30 minutes for the hotel, my fellow traveler and I check in to find that they give you the TV remote when you check in. Never a good sign. You enter the room, and my first thought was 1950s New Jersey Shore with no updates or cleaning since that time. Thankfully, no critters, but rust everywhere. Never seen more of it in my life. The Internet was not working (not a huge surprise I suppose), and I really did not want to get into the bed without a full body covering. The air conditioning only semi-worked. Breakfast on our second morning started 30 minutes later, so we could not get any before leaving for our business meeting. All in all, a bad hotel that I would never return to. Try Villa Montana instead - equally as difficult to find, but the restaurant was fabulous and the ocean view amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: maythefal
Reviews.Content: First of all, I did not choose this hotel. I had no option, as I was attending a marriage seminar and the hotel was chosen by the organizers. We stayed for a weekend, and I was ready to get divorced if I had to stay a day longer (which kind of beats the purpose of the weekend). The rooms were quite comfortable, and that is the only good thing about them. There was very poor lighting, and the bathroom was a nightmare. The bathtub was stained and rusty, really disgusting. The air conditioner is turned off when the rooms are not in use, and there is a lot of humidity, so you can imagine the smell when we walked into the room. My husband had to take down a screen to be able to open a window to let the room air out (no balcony in our room). The pillows were really thin, and when we asked for extra pillows, there were none (they had already been distributed to other complaining guests). A couple that was attending the seminar had to go out and buy their own pillows. The staff was friendly, but couldn't really provide much service. On the positive side, the view is great and if you have kids, the pool is designed for their entertainment, with slides and waterfalls. But I have no plans on ever staying there again. If I need another weekend escape, I'll stay somewhere else in Puerto Rico. We have much better hotels, where the rates are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Rooms And Service!!!!! Would Not Recommend This At All...”
Reviews.Author: magikmann
Reviews.Content: This place looks beautiful on the website but it's the opposite. The rooms have old chipped furniture. There's no water pressure at all in the bathroom shower and sink. Room service never changed the sheets of the beds. Room service never came by to clean up the room or make the bed. I and relatives stayed there for 4 days and were disgusted/disatified with the rooms and service. I would not recommend this. The only thing this place has going for it is the bar with the ocean scene. But bar closes around 1030 or so, not good.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Cielo Mar”
Reviews.Author: hmlallave
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this establishment and would not recommend it . The halls were dirty, the music from the weekend parties were blasting and we could not sleep. The resturant was closed on Saturday even though we had the package deal. The staff made no effort to accomdate our needs. This place needs a great over haul. Millie Florida

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Geri168
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 kids stayed at Cielo Mar from August 15 - 20th. The hotel was clean and we stayed at the new building. We were told we could get the ocean view room but the day we arrived they were working on installin new A/C's, so they put us in the new building instead. The room was big and clean. Very large bathroom. We were really only in the room at night to sleep and take showers. They had a nice video game room, which the kids utilized. They had a nice pool, but we were never around in the day time to use it. Overall the hotel was nice and we would definitely stay there again because the price was right (approx $83 per night).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stood here for 4 days and it was beautiful. Im a clean freak and the room was perfect, we had been previously staying at El Guajataca was a disaster the place was terrible. The staff was so nice they had learned about our terrible experience at the other place that they let us check in to our room about 3 hours pior to check in. The staff all speak english which worked out great for us and the restuarant had great food. They have a nice pool and also have wireless internet service and the even have a computer room for the guests to use. I definetly recommend this place to anyone and I would stay here again. What is also great is that the airport in Aguadilla is literally five minutes away, alot of people dont know that this airport has major Airline companies flying in there like Jet Blue. Also you have Ramey base within minutes from here. It's very easy to get to from the major highway #2. And parking is free, not like some other places who charge an additional fee for parking. You have Crash boat beach within minutes. Overall this place is great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “3RD world accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and services are practically non-existant. After 2 days they finally fixed the beds...The dining facility was only operating on weekends, if there were enough guests in the hotel. Currently there is construction going on in the pool area. Unfortunately the noise starts at 7 am, someone forgot to tell management that guests sleep past early morning. You definately need a car because there's nothing within walking distance. There are better hotels in Aguadilla but they lack the ocean view. However, the view isn't worth the construction noise and poor services.

Reviews.Title: “Breathless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The view from the bar is heaven sent. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend it to anyone and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money and A Great View”
Reviews.Author: Forester67
Reviews.Content: We had a third story room that cost us $70. The hotel is located just above the coastline. Our room (as do most of their rooms) had a small balcony with two chairs and a small table that overlooked the ocean. It was an outstanding view, especially at sunset. The room was very clean and of an adequate size for my wife and me. It had a TV and air conditioning. There was also a nice looking on-site restaurant (although we didn't eat there) and a very nice swimming pool. I highly recommend it. You can't beat the value. The view alone was worth the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Cielo Mar
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Montemar 84, Aguadilla 00603, Puerto Rico
